alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 8:19PM PDT until March 23 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected at prone low lying and coastal locations across the coast during the high tide cycles of the Wednesday and Wednesday night into Thursday early morning. * WHERE...San Francisco, Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, North Bay Interior Valleys and San Francisco Bay Shoreline Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Storm surge of 1 to 2 feet will raise tidal levels. Flooding is expected to affect areas similar to those that flood in King Tide events. The astronomical high tide levels are expected to peak at 1:18 AM on Thursday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline
